thread.title: Vancouver International Film Festival: Three to see on Monday
thread.title_full: Vancouver International Film Festival: Three to see on Monday

title: Vancouver International Film Festival: Three to see on Monday
text:
Laura Gabbert’s accessible, close-up documentary of Los Angeles Times food critic Jonathan Gold, is a must for any foodie worth his or her rico pollo. 
Big ticket 
Argentina (Spain, France, Argentina) 
Carlos Saura follows up his seductive flamenco trilogy with a ravishing film that focuses on the allure of the tango, while taking in all aspects of Argentine folk culture. “My desire is to create a cinematographic experience like no other,” Saura says. 
6:15 p.m., Centre for Performing Arts 
Hidden gem 
City of Gold (USA) 
Pulitzer Prize-winning Los Angeles Times food critic Jonathan Gold takes viewers on a culinary tour. Laura Gabbert’s accessible, close-up documentary is a must for any foodie worth his or her rico pollo. “A celebration of both L.A. food and L.A.’s global culture.” — Eater. 
4:30 p.m., International Village #10 
B.C. watch 
Eadweard 
Recounting the real-life endeavours of Eadweard Muybridge, whose 19th-century photographic methods became the template for movies, first time director Kyle Rideout’s beautifully shot film captures a mad genius of sorts (played by Michael Eklund). 
8:45 p.m., Vancouver Playhouse 
Tickets and more info: viff.org © Copyright (c) The Vancouver Sun
